attractions.name: Ta’ Qali National Park
attractions.description: Located centrally, this park is an oasis of relaxation offering play areas, botanical gardens, and open spaces perfect for picnics and family outings.

attractions.name: Mdina
attractions.description: Once the capital of Malta, this ancient walled city boasts of history spanning over 4,000 years. A blend of medieval and baroque architecture provides a time-travel experience.

attractions.name: Rabat
attractions.description: Adjacent to Mdina, Rabat is known for its catacombs, historical churches, and charming streets reflecting Roman and medieval past.

attractions.name: Dingli Cliffs
attractions.description: Malta's highest cliffs offer stunning sea views and an insight into the island's natural beauty. A tranquil spot especially during sunset.

attractions.name: Mosta Rotunda
attractions.description: One of Europe's largest unsupported domes, the Mosta Rotunda is an architectural marvel and also known for the World War II bomb which failed to explode inside.

attractions.name: San Anton Gardens
attractions.description: A beautifully landscaped garden that was once the private residence of Malta's governors. It's a calm retreat featuring diverse flora and fauna.

attractions.name: The Limestone Heritage
attractions.description: This attraction showcases Malta's stone masonry and sculpture tradition, tracing back to the island's ancient temples.

attractions.name: L-Arka ta’ Noe
attractions.description: A captivating sanctuary housing various animal species, ensuring they have a loving home. A testament to Malta's dedication to animal care.

attractions.name: Valletta
attractions.description: The capital city of Malta, Valletta is a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its historical buildings, museums, and beautiful harbors. Every corner of this city tells a tale of its rich history.

attractions.name: Fort St. Elmo
attractions.description: Guarding the harbors of Valletta, this fort played a pivotal role during the Great Siege of 1565. Its walls have witnessed numerous historic battles.

attractions.name: St. John's Co-Cathedral in Valletta
attractions.description: An architectural gem from the outside, the interior dazzles with baroque art, including Caravaggio's masterpiece - The Beheading of Saint John.

attractions.name: Marsamxett Harbour and the Three Cities
attractions.description: A natural harbor offering panoramic views, surrounded by the ancient cities of Birgu, Senglea, and Cospicua, each steeped in history.

attractions.name: Sliema and the Tigne Point
attractions.description: A modern cityscape juxtaposed with historical fortifications. The Tigne Point offers shopping, dining, and sweeping views of Valletta.

attractions.name: St. Julian’s
attractions.description: A hub for nightlife and entertainment, St. Julian's blends coastal beauty with urban luxury, making it a hotspot for tourists and locals alike.

attractions.name: Marsaxlokk
attractions.description: A picturesque fishing village known for its vibrant market, colorful boats, and the serene Marsaxlokk Bay which reflects the island's deep connection with the sea.

attractions.name: Blue Grotto
attractions.description: A series of mesmerizing sea caves offering an ethereal experience with its azure waters, especially when the sunlight reflects off the white seabed.

attractions.name: Hal Seflieni Hypogeum
attractions.description: An underground architectural marvel, this ancient burial site provides a rare glimpse into the prehistoric period of Malta. Booking in advance is highly recommended.

attractions.name: Tarxien Temples
attractions.description: Among the oldest free-standing structures in the world, these temples stand as a testament to Malta's ancient past and architectural prowess.

attractions.name: Mnajdra and Ħaġar Qim Temples
attractions.description: Set on a hilltop, these temples offer panoramic views of the sea and are significant archaeological sites that reflect Malta's Megalithic period.

attractions.name: Ghar Dalam Cave
attractions.description: Known as the 'Cave of Darkness', this site offers insights into Malta's prehistory, housing fossils that date back thousands of years.

attractions.name: Wied il-Ghasri
attractions.description: A secluded and serene valley ending in a cove. A picturesque location that showcases the natural beauty and landscapes of Gozo.

attractions.name: Gozo's Inland Sea and Azure Window site
attractions.description: Although the iconic Azure Window no longer stands, the site remains a significant attraction. Close by is the Inland Sea, a unique geological feature offering a blend of natural beauty.

attractions.name: it-Tempji tal-Ggantija
attractions.description: These megalithic temples are among the world's oldest free-standing structures, highlighting Gozo's ancient civilization and architectural wonders.

attractions.name: Bazilika Tal-Madonna Ta’ Pinu Mill Gharb
attractions.description: A revered sanctuary and an architectural masterpiece, this basilica stands as a symbol of faith and devotion in Gozo.

attractions.name: Victoria
attractions.description: The capital of Gozo, Victoria, also known as Rabat, is a blend of historic sites, narrow streets, and daily Maltese life.

attractions.name: Sanap Cliffs
attractions.description: Offering panoramic views of Gozo's southern coast, these cliffs stand as a testament to the island's rugged and untouched beauty.

attractions.name: Ramla Beach
attractions.description: Gozo's largest sandy beach, Ramla Bay is renowned for its unique red sand and historical legends, including the mythical Calypso's cave.

days.day: Day 5: Comino and Remaining Spots in Malta

attractions.name: Blue Lagoon Comino Island
attractions.description: A paradise for beach lovers, the Blue Lagoon on Comino Island boasts crystal-clear turquoise waters and pristine white sands. A haven for snorkelers and divers, its serene beauty and water activities make it a must-visit. However, it's recommended to get there early to beat the crowds and truly enjoy its tranquility.

attractions.name: Popeye Village
attractions.description: Once the film set for the 1980 'Popeye' movie, this vibrant and colorful village has been transformed into a fun-filled attraction for visitors. Offering a unique experience with its wooden buildings, water activities, and live performances, it's a step into the whimsical world of the sailor man himself.

attractions.name: Golden Bay
attractions.description: One of Malta's most renowned beaches, Golden Bay is blessed with golden sands and clear blue waters, making it a favorite spot for sunbathing, swimming, and enjoying Maltese sunsets. The surrounding cliffs provide a picturesque backdrop, enhancing the beach's natural allure.

attractions.name: Malta West Coast
attractions.description: A diverse landscape featuring rugged cliffs, hidden coves, and picturesque bays, Malta's West Coast is an explorer's dream. Each spot provides a unique perspective of the island's natural beauty and the vast Mediterranean Sea.
